column4: why cant I get my second HD mounted with /dev/sdb1 /media/STORAGE ntfs defaults 0 0 ?
anyone?
what does "sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sdb1 /media/STORAGE" say?
what does "sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sdb1 /media/STORAGE" say?
fuse: failed to access mountpoint /media/STORAGE: No such file or directory
mkdir /media/STORAGE and then "sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/sdb1 /media/STORAGE"
ok that mounted it
umount /media/STORAGE and your fstab should work now
I think maybe i didnt make the directory STORAGE that's why right?
100% correct ;)
lol yeah i thought it would make it itself :P thanks for the help
easy to miss if you're used to hotplug ;)
yeah thanks :D
would u happen to also know the difference between xclient script and gnome?
gnome is a desktop environment and xclient script sounds like a script
lol yeah i know gnome the thing is my login is set to startup as xclient script yet it starts up as gnome that's why i was wondering why xclient script starts gnome
at the login screen you can choose which session to use (default, gnome, last used, etc) maybe that can help ?
yeah im just wondering like the default is set to xclient script yet it starts with gnome ;)
/usr/share/icons or something like that
i already got him covered on that :P
was afk for a while, didn't follow ;)
yeah np
